articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israel-affiliated merchant vessel was struck by an uncrewed aerial vehicle off India's west coast, British maritime security firm Ambrey said on Saturday, in the first such known attack so far away from the Red Sea since the Gaza war.
articles.title: Israel-affiliated merchant vessel hit by aerial vehicle off India

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: Two Colorado paramedics were found guilty of criminally negligent homicide by a jury on Friday for their role in the 2019 death of Elijah McClain, a young Black man who died after police roughly detained him, put him in a choke hold, and the medics injected him with a powerful sedative.
articles.title: Colorado paramedics found guilty in death of Elijah McClain

articles.author: Mohammed Ghobari
articles.description: The Saudi-backed Yemeni government and Iran-aligned Houthis have both committed to steps towards a ceasefire, the U.N. special envoy for Yemen said on Saturday.
articles.title: Yemen's warring parties commit to ceasefire steps - U.N. special envoy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Around 300 Indian nationals who were on board a plane grounded in France on suspicion of human trafficking were being cared for on Saturday in the hall of an airport in the eastern region of Marne while an investigation was ongoing, a local official said.
articles.title: French airport provides makeshift base for Indians on grounded flight

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: The U.N. Security Council approved a toned-down bid to boost humanitarian aid to Gaza on Friday that stopped short of a call for a ceasefire, hours after Israel signalled it was widening its ground offensive in the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: UN pushes for more aid into Gaza, Israel widens offensive

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: Republican presidential contender Nikki Haley has risen in opinion polls in recent months largely on the back of college-educated, affluent, suburban professionals, many of whom have tired of Donald Trump's caustic rhetoric and legal troubles.
articles.title: To beat Trump, Nikki Haley tries to expand coalition, and fast

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bells rang across the Czech Republic on Saturday and flags flew at half mast as the country mourned victims of the country's worst mass shooting that killed 14 at a Prague university on Thursday.
articles.title: Bells ring across Czech Republic to mourn victims of mass shooting

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Former TV journalist Yekaterina Duntsova was disqualified on Saturday as a candidate for Russia's next presidential election, preventing her from running against Vladimir Putin on a platform of opposition to the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Yekaterina Duntsova barred from running against Putin in election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's draft online video gaming rules were designed to promote the healthy development of the industry, regulators said on Saturday, adding that the government would further improve the proposed rules after "earnestly studying" public views.
articles.title: China regulator to 'earnestly study' public concerns over draft video gaming rules

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Follow on Apple, Google or Spotify. Listen on the Reuters app. Read the episode transcript.
articles.title: Ready for rate cuts? The gap between the Fed and Europe
